p:
The epidemiological model can be described schematically as shown in Fig. 1(b). Motivated by research that shows that mosquitoes have a very limited flight range and infection is carried by human movement
15, 16, 29, 30 , we assume mosquitoes to have a fixed location, i.e. there is no interaction between mosquito populations in distinct grid cells. For this reason, humans are treated as distinct agents, while the values for mosquitoes are aggregated at the cell level. The transitions on the proposed epidemiological model depend on temperature dependent parameters as reported in Table 1 and described in the Supplementary materials (see also Figs S6 and S7 in the supplementary materials). The constant parameters are described in Table 2.
